title: Support Shift+Enter for multi-line input in TUI dialogs
body:
## Problem

When using agent-deck with terminals that support the Kitty Keyboard Protocol (e.g., Ghostty), **Shift+Enter does not create a newline** in input fields. This makes it difficult to compose multi-line prompts when creating or forking sessions.

Additionally, **text selection and copy don't work as expected** when attached to sessions, since tmux mouse mode intercepts these events.

## Current Behavior

- Input dialogs use single-line `textinput.Model` components
- No alternative keybinding exists for inserting newlines (Alt+Enter, Ctrl+j, etc.)
- Users must pre-compose multi-line text externally and paste it

## Proposed Solution

1. **Upgrade to Bubble Tea v2** with progressive keyboard enhancements to support Shift+Enter detection via the Kitty Keyboard Protocol
2. **Use `textarea.Model`** instead of `textinput.Model` for fields where multi-line input is useful (e.g., session prompts)
3. Alternatively, add a fallback keybinding like **Alt+Enter** or **Ctrl+Enter** for newlines

## Environment

- Terminal: Ghostty (supports Kitty Keyboard Protocol)
- OS: macOS

## References

- [Bubble Tea v2 keyboard enhancements](https://github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea/discussions/1374)
- [Bubble Tea textarea linebreaks discussion](https://github.com/charmbracelet/bubbletea/issues/800)
